original: Löfgren, Agne Johan Fredrik, kommendörkapten av första gr., Karlskrona, f. 29/12/96 i Sthlm av fil. dr Ture Fredrik L. o. Augusta Barbara Hol-zer. G. 1. 20 m. Margit von Geger-felt, d. 35; 2. 38 m. Vera Sjöstrand. Barn: Bertil f. 25, Claes-Henric 41. — Stud :ex. v. norra real i Sthlm 15, sjökadett 15, KSS 15-18, off:ex. 18, KSHS 24. Fänrik 18, löjtn. 20, kapt. 32, kommikapt. av andra gr. 40, av första gr. 42. Fartygschef å torpedb. nr 12 24, vedettb. nr 34 26, torpedb. Itair 27, Castor 28-29, adjut. h. KCK 30^-32, tjg. i KMF 34-38, fartygschef å jag. Ragnar 36, Nordenskjöld 36-37, Vale 39-40 o. Psdlander 40-42, skolchef v. Sthlms örlogsstat. 42-43, fartygschef å pansarsk. Sverige 43-44, chef f. avd. Sparre i Karlskrona sed. 44. Medf. sjöexp. t. avlägsna farvatten 26-27 o. 40. RSO, RVO, Off-ItKrO, FFrK4kl m sv, TorpedM.
translated: Löfgren, Agne Johan Fredrik, Commander Captain First Grade, Karlskrona, born on December 29, 1896 in Stockholm, son of PhD Ture Fredrik L. and Augusta Barbara Holzer. Married 1. in 1920 to Margit von Geerfeldt, died in 1935; 2. in 1938 to Vera Sjöstrand. Children: Bertil born in 1925, Claes-Henric in 1941. Studied at Norra Real in Stockholm until 1915, naval cadet from 1915, at the Royal Swedish Naval Academy from 1915-1918, officer from 1918, at the Royal Swedish Naval Staff College from 1924. Promoted to Ensign in 1918, Lieutenant in 1920, Captain in 1932, Lieutenant Commander Second Grade in 1940, and Lieutenant Commander First Grade in 1942. Served as the ship's commander on Torpedo Boat No. 12 in 1924, on Vedette Boat No. 34 in 1926, on Torpedo Boat Italir in 1927, on Castor from 1928-1929, as an adjutant at the Royal Court in Stockholm from 1930-1932, on the minesweeper Ragnar in 1936, Nordenskjöld in 1936-1937, Vale in 1939-1940, and Psdlander in 1940-1942. Served as the school director at the Stockholm Naval Base from 1942-1943, as the ship's commander on the battleship Sverige from 1943-1944, and as the division chief Sparre in Karlskrona since 1944. Accompanied naval expeditions to distant waters in 1926-1927 and 1940. Awarded with Royal Order of the Seraphim, Royal Order of Vasa, Officer of the Order of the Sword, Fourth Class with Sword Device, Naval Commemorative Medal.
